articles.author: Ian McMahan
articles.title: With more active lifestyle, average adult could live 5.3 years longer - The Washington Post
articles.description: The least active Americans appear to have the most to gain.
articles.content:
Americans over ae 40 could live an extra 5.3 years if they were as active as the top 25 percent of the population, according to just-published research in the British Journal of Sports Medicine.

articles.content:
Capt. Omer Neutra, 21, died on October 7 of last year, and his body was taken by Hamas to the Gaza Strip, the IDF confirmed on Monday.

articles.title: A twice-yearly shot could help end AIDS. But will it get to everyone who needs it? - The Associated Press
articles.description: A twice-yearly shot that prevents HIV infections will be available at low cost in 120 poor countries. But nearly all of Latin America was exluded from the deal with drugmaker Gilead, sparking concern the world is missing a critical opportunity to stop AIDS. T…
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (AP) Its been called the closest the world has ever come to a vaccine against the AIDS virus.
